hangarMiscSystems.name: Hangar
hangarMiscSystems.description: The hangar is an internal docking, launch, storage, and service facility for embarked craft. It requires 1 hull point for each hull point of embarked craft. Ships of 100 HP or more cannot fit in any hangar. Hangars may launch or recover no more than one craft per phase per hangar.

hangarMiscSystems.name: Docking Clamps
hangarMiscSystems.description: The docking clamp is a hardpoint and airlock where another ship can secure itself to the hull. Maximum capacity is 10 HP per 2 HP installed. Embarked craft are outside the hull, not protected by armor or life support. Cannot enter atmosphere while craft are attached. Embarked ships may not exceed 10% of carrier's hull.

hangarMiscSystems.name: Magazine
hangarMiscSystems.description: Carriers whose embarked craft rely on dropped ordnance or missiles require vast ordnance stores. Each hull point spent on magazines can store 4 size points of missiles, mines, or bombs.

hangarMiscSystems.name: Cargo Space
hangarMiscSystems.description: One hull point provides enough space for 10 cubic meters of cargo, or one cargo unit. A compartment 2 meters tall, 2 meters wide, and 2.5 meters deep would be typical.

hangarMiscSystems.name: Cargo Bay
hangarMiscSystems.description: Two hull points provide enough space for 50 cubic meters of cargo (25 per HP). More efficient than cargo space because bulkheads, hatches, monitoring, and climate control don't need to be duplicated. Includes exterior hatch (not airlock).

hangarMiscSystems.name: Cargo Hold
hangarMiscSystems.description: Three hull points provide space for 100 cubic meters of cargo. Most efficient cargo option. Includes a large cargo or vehicular airlock for exterior access.

hangarMiscSystems.name: Airlock
hangarMiscSystems.description: A small compartment with two heavy-duty hatches and pumps/controls to pressurize or depressurize. Ships automatically include one free airlock per command deck, crew quarters, bunkroom, docking clamp, hangar, cargo hold, or ordnance transfer system.

hangarMiscSystems.name: Escape Pod
hangarMiscSystems.description: A stripped-down boarding pod carrying ten people with 100 man-days of air and supplies. Equipped with emergency distress beacon and automated landing program. Power cells allow up to 6 hours of flight.

hangarMiscSystems.name: Reentry Capsule
hangarMiscSystems.description: An emergency escape device with room for two people. After ejection, has enough air and survival supplies for ten days. Can de-orbit and make planetfall if launched within 10,000 km of a planet's surface.

hangarMiscSystems.name: Fuel Collector
hangarMiscSystems.description: Allows a ship to process fuel from sources found in desolate star systems. Gas giants hold hydrogen reserves; water can be found on planets, moons, and comets. Each unit can process enough fuel to fill a 1 HP tank in one day.

hangarMiscSystems.name: Brig
hangarMiscSystems.description: Accommodations for undesirable passengers. Each two hull points provides individual cells for four individuals, plus a security station, interrogation room, visiting area, and alarm system.

hangarMiscSystems.name: Lab Section
hangarMiscSystems.description: Small number of offices, laboratories, and conference rooms for scientific work. Four scientists can work comfortably, up to a dozen with crowding. Includes an Ordinary-quality mainframe with Physical Science, Life Science, and Technical Science databases.

hangarMiscSystems.name: Sick Bay
hangarMiscSystems.effect: -1/-2/-3 step bonus to Medical Science at PL 6/7/8
hangarMiscSystems.description: Small shipboard hospital with care and treatment facilities for up to four in-patients. Includes operating theater, medical equipment and supplies, and vitals monitoring. Quality improves with Progress Level.

hangarMiscSystems.name: Workshop
hangarMiscSystems.effect: +3 step penalty to repair mortal damage
hangarMiscSystems.description: Small but lavishly equipped machine shop for repair work, light manufacturing, and special fabrication jobs. Makes it possible to attempt repairs of mortal damage in space, but with a +3 step penalty.

hangarMiscSystems.name: Accumulator
hangarMiscSystems.description: Stores extra power points. Each hull point can store up to 10 excess power points, which can be allocated like normal power points. Once spent, unavailable until recharged. Useful for quick weapon recharges or emergency maneuvers.

hangarMiscSystems.name: Autocargo
hangarMiscSystems.description: Automated cargo loading and handling machinery that provides service to cargo holds, bays, or spaces totaling 6 hull points or less. Allows rapid loading or unloading of cargo, handling heavy or awkward loads with ease.

hangarMiscSystems.name: Boarding Pod
hangarMiscSystems.description: Small assault module with gravity induction engine. Holds ten troops in normal gear or six in body tanks. Acceleration 0.5, MC 2, power for 10 game rounds. Has 5/5/2 stun/wound/mortal points, Good toughness, 1d4 armor. Uses mechanical grapples to fasten to enemy hull.

hangarMiscSystems.name: Evacuation System
hangarMiscSystems.description: System of four escape pods designed for large ships. Each pod holds 10 people with 100 man-days of supplies and 6 hours of flight at acceleration 1. Can be expanded: each additional HP provides two more pods at $50K each.

hangarMiscSystems.name: Fabrication Facility
hangarMiscSystems.effect: Enables mortal damage repair in space
hangarMiscSystems.description: Large automated workshop with manufacturing computer holding design specs for thousands of devices. Virtually any part of the ship can be duplicated. Enables repair of mortal damage without returning to a shipyard.

hangarMiscSystems.name: Ordnance Transfer System
hangarMiscSystems.effect: Reloads external ordnance in d4×10 minutes instead of d4 hours
hangarMiscSystems.description: Special airlock and ordnance transfer crane or tractor beam. Can reload external missile racks, bomb racks, or ordnance cells in d4×10 minutes instead of d4 hours. Ammo carriers are often fitted with this system.

hangarMiscSystems.name: Security Suite
hangarMiscSystems.description: Video, sound, and thermal monitoring of protected compartments by surveillance computers. Heavy-duty armored security hatches with key card, retinal scan, or positive control. Includes four weapon cupolas for ranged or heavy weapons.

hangarMiscSystems.name: Stabilizer
hangarMiscSystems.description: Modification to the ship's engine system that increases maneuverability. Ship equipped with powered stabilizer increases its base Maneuverability Class by 1 point. Requires 5% of hull and 1 power per HP.

hangarMiscSystems.name: Holofield Bay
hangarMiscSystems.effect: -2 step bonus to Teach skill checks
hangarMiscSystems.description: Uses virtual matter and holoprojection technology to create fully immersive virtual reality. Good for extremely realistic training (-2 step bonus to Teach skill checks) and entertainment.

hangarMiscSystems.name: Nanomanufacture Bay
hangarMiscSystems.effect: -1 step bonus to repair mortal damage
hangarMiscSystems.description: Combines fabrication facility machines with a nanite tank - a large fluid-filled chamber where microscopic devices can construct virtually anything from crude raw materials. Ship's engineer gains -1 step bonus to repair checks for mortal damage.
